Class Canvas

Manages the HTML canvas belonging to a View.

Readonly boundary

boundary: number[]
  • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/view/Canvas.ts:32

Boundary of the Canvas in absolute browser window coordinates. Format is [xmin, ymin, xwidth, ywidth].

    Default value is [1, 1, 1].

backgroundColorFromAmbientLight

  • get backgroundColorFromAmbientLight(): boolean
  • set backgroundColorFromAmbientLight(backgroundColorFromAmbientLight: boolean): void
    • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/view/Canvas.ts:171

    Gets whether the canvas clear color will be derived from AmbientLight or {@link Canvas#backgroundColor} when {@link Canvas#transparent} is true.

    When {@link Canvas#transparent} is true and this is true, then the canvas clear color will be taken from the Scene's ambient light color.

    When {@link Canvas#transparent} is true and this is false, then the canvas clear color will be taken from {@link Canvas#backgroundColor}.

    Default value is true.

    Returns boolean

    • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/view/Canvas.ts:183

    Sets if the canvas background color is derived from an AmbientLight.

    This only has effect when the canvas is not transparent. When not enabled, the background color will be the canvas element's HTML/CSS background color.

    Default value is true.

    Parameters

    • backgroundColorFromAmbientLight: boolean

    Returns void

resolutionScale

  • get resolutionScale(): number
  • set resolutionScale(resolutionScale: number): void
    • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/view/Canvas.ts:196

    Gets the scale of the canvas back buffer relative to the CSS-defined size of the canvas.

    This is a common way to trade off rendering quality for speed. If the canvas size is defined in CSS, then setting this to a value between [0..1] (eg 0.5) will render into a smaller back buffer, giving a performance boost.

    Returns number

    The resolution scale.

    • Defined in viewer/src/viewer/view/Canvas.ts:209

    Sets the scale of the canvas back buffer relative to the CSS-defined size of the canvas.

    This is a common way to trade off rendering quality for speed. If the canvas size is defined in CSS, then setting this to a value between [0..1] (eg 0.5) will render into a smaller back buffer, giving a performance boost.

    Parameters

    • resolutionScale: number

      The resolution scale.

    Returns void

    The resolution scale.
